characters: THEN WHAT THE HELL ARE YOU DOING INSIDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cold, windy evening in New England. Bare, looming trees line the sides of the desolate road. Suddenly, the darkne is broken by fast approaching LIGHTS. We see a speeding L Rover round a bend. INT. LAND ROVER - NIGHT. We pull in from the rear, revealing a mess of books and clothing including a distinctive BLACK PARKA. Driving the car is a cute, curly-haired, twenty year-old, MICHELLE MANCINI. She listens attentively to a “Lovelines” style t show on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You're listening to After Dark with Sasha on WVOP, the Voice of Pendelton University. Caller, you're on the air.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This is, um, Jane.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Seems to be a run on “Janes” tonight. How can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Well, I’m having sexual thoughts about my roommate.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Is she aware of this?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: No. I don’t think so. But, honestly Sasha, I'm not a lesbian.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Are you dating any guys? JANE. No.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Do you think about guys?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Um. Not really.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: How many Indigo Girls albums do you own? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: All of them.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Then Jane, I think it's time you wake up and smell the coffee over at Ellen’s house because you are way confused. Head immediately to the lesbian student lobby, make some new gal pals and once you've come to terms, see if roomie wouldn’t be up for a little Sapphic soul searching. Thank you, next caller. Michelle laughs, then pops a tape into the stereo. Bonnie Tyler’s 80's power ballad, “Total Eclipse of the Heart” starts BLASTING. Michelle sings along, not too convincing

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Turn around/every now and then I get a little bit terrified and then I see the look in your eyes... The sunroof is open and the moon softly illuminates Miche She’s too entertained to notice a FLASHING LIGHT on the console...the low fuel gauge. She speeds past a large She station. INT. LAND ROVER ~ NIGHT. The car begins sputtering. She turns the radio down and notices the light and accompanying BEEPING.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (panicked) Oh no... : Through the windshield, she sees a rundown gas station in distance. MICHELLE (cont’d) Please...please make it. The car is on its last fume. It sputters into the station and dies. Michelle breathes a sigh of relief. A creepy, disheveled ATTENDANT steps out of his office and walks to car. Michelle opens the window just a crack.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: (stuttering) R-r-ran out of g-g-g-gas? MICHELLE (cont’d) Yeah. Fill it up please. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slips her credit card through the crack. He stares at her, nods and walks away. MICHELLE (cont‘d) (to herself) Freak show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gas hose is in the tank filling up. INT. LAND ROVER - NIGHT. Michelle looks at her watch impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: M-m-m-miss? She turns to look. He’s calling out from his office door.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: C-c-can you p-p-please come here for a m- m-m-minute?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Um. Credit c-c-c-ard company. They‘re on t-t-the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Is there a problem?

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: They s-s-say they w-w-want to speak to you.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Hold on. She grabs mace spray and sticks it in her coat pocket. INT. OFFICE - NIGHT. It’s dark and dingy, the only light a dim, flickering fluorescent bulb. Michelle steps inside and the attendant immediately closes the door behind her, locking it witha key. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: So where's the phone?

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: (nervously) M-m-m-iss...T-t-t-here- MICHELLE’S POV On the desk sits the phone...unplugged from the wall. She slowly begins to walk backwards towards the door. ATTENDANT (cont’d) S-s-s-ome- He goes to grab her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Don’t touch me!

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: No...no! There's s-s-s- She reaches the door...it’s locked. He grabs her shoulder firmly and turns her to face him. ATTENDANT (cont'd) S-s-s-omeone --

dialogues.speaker: HER COAT POCKET
dialogues.text: She grabs the mace and fidgets around trying to remove th protective lock. ATTENDANT (cont'd) is-is-is -- She unlocks the mace, shoves it in front of his eyes and sprays. ATTENDANT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: AAAAAHHHH
dialogues.text: The attendant keels over. MICHELLE tries in vain to unlock the door. She turns arou and sees... THE ATTENDANT writhing in pain on the floor. ON THE DESK she spots the unplugged phone and grabs it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She SMASHES the door window until there’s an opening big enough for her to fit through. Her gloves and coat protec her from the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's halfway out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attendant gets up. Her legs are dangling inside. He grabs them. She SCREAMS and starts kicking, hitting him i the groin. ATTENDANT (cont'd) (holding himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle falls out and runs to her car. She's fumbling around with her keys when... THE ATTENDANT opens the office door. He's approaching. Sh can't find the right key. He’s almost there. Finally, she gets the key and leaps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts the engine and looks around. He’s nowhere in sight, when -- EXT. GAS STATION - NIGHT. iL HE JUMPS in front of the car, shining menacingly in the headlights.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: There’s S-s-some-!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle hits the accelerator SMASHING into the attendant He's clinging onto the hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gas hose flies out of the tank spilling gasoline all the ground. Michelle makes a sharp turn into the road and the attendant falls off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He gets up and hobbles to the road trying to chase after car. It’s useless. He yells out and, finally, his words come out without a stutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's already too far to hear his warning. As she sobs hysterically, she doesn’t notice...

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND HER
dialogues.text: the black parka we’d seen earlier begin to move slightly.

dialogues.speaker: STEREO
dialogues.text: She presses “Play” on the tape player. “Total Eclipse of Heart” again. She sings along, trying to make herself fee better.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Turn around, bright eyes/every now and then I fall apart/Turn around, bright...

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND HER
dialogues.text: The FIGURE in the black parka rises. His face obscured by furry hood. He raises an ax and begins to inch towards Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: REARVIEW MIRROR
dialogues.text: Hanging from it is a blue and gold TASSEL with “96” pinne it. Michelle looks in the mirror. It’s completely black. She adjusts it and catches the reflection of the fur-trim parka hood. She turns around. HE’S RIGHT BEHIND HER Her eyes widen. The SONG is reaching its crescendo. “Turn around...every now and then I fall apart!”

dialogues.speaker: THE AX
dialogues.text: The killer swings. With a squishy THUD, her head is slice and flies straight out the sunroof.  15 16

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The head rolls over the top of the car, mouth agape, eyes widened in terror, and rolls RIGHT TOWARDS US until its m fills the entire screen.

dialogues.speaker: SLAM CUT TO
dialogues.text: A MOUTH, yawning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back to reveal NATALIE SIMON, a dark-haired, good looking twenty year-old staring straight ahead. Natalie's a serious type-A personality who'd probably fee more comfortable in a Donna Karan power suit than the gre goose down jacket she’s currently donning. She knows exac what she wants out of life and has no time to waste...her Runner is her bible.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I won’t encourage this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Gothic, stone building. Its windows boarded with wood a its front door locked with a heavy chain. The molding abo the front door clearly reads, “Stanley Hall.” : Next to her stands her friend BRENDA. She’s tall and athletic and blonde. Her carefree demeanor the antithesis Natalie. BRENDA . Cut me a little slack. I just transferred here this year. Now do I say Bloody Mary five or six times before I hear the spirits?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Brenda, give it up. You’re not exactly the midget lady from “Poltergeist.”

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Are you scared Natalie? Natalie laughs.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Right. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brenda grabs Natalie by the arm and pulls her towards the dorm. NATALIE (cont'd) Here we go. Brenda stops in front of a window and peers in through a crack.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Bloody Mary -- Natalie rolls her eyes. BRENDA (cont’d) Bloody Mary. Bloody Mary. Bloody Mary. Brenda looks at Natalie. Takes a deep breath, and...

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (okay, I’m over this) Bloody Mary. Suddenly, we hear what sound like far-off, tortured SCREA Brenda and Natalie look at one another. They’re nervous. The SCREAMS are getting louder and louder.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Come on. They start to back away when... A FIGURE appears behind them holding a light under his fa They turn around and SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: BUAAAAAA
dialogues.text: He LAUGHS hysterically. It’s Damon, goateed frat brother campus practical joker. DAMON (cont ’d) You called?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: She was trying to summon the dead Damon, not frat boys with badly grown facial hair. Damon instinctively touches his goatee. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: What do you mean? It took me a month to get this. Natalie smirks. He smiles at her flirtatiously. DAMON (cont’d) Anyway...it‘ll still tickle you in all the right spots.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Keep dreaming man-boy.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (angry) So is this what you do with your free time? Hang out in the rain by yourself waiting to scare people like a total freak?

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Nah. Only when I see some idiot standing in front of the dorm trying to summon the dead. He points to the frat house behind them. DAMON (cont'd) I can see you through my window. Night girls. See ya in class tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Unfortunately.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: See ya. He walks away. Natalie puts her arm around Brenda. NATALIE (cont'd) Don’t tell me, tomorrow we're breaking out the Ouija board and getting fashion tips from Versace. Brenda shrugs her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Not a bad idea. They look at each other and laugh.  17 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small and cramped with posters of obscure college rock ba hanging on the walls. A window looks onto the engineering room where the ENGINEER sits, slouching over the controls We see a heavily made up, perfectly accessorized college standing with a wireless mike headset. This is SASHA, who voice we heard earlier. She commands the airwaves like a and sexy Dr. Ruth and becomes very animated as she speaks

dialogues.speaker: BIJOU, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (overmodulated)

dialogues.speaker: HELLO
dialogues.text: Sasha turns around, snaps her finger at the engineer and. motions with her hand for him to lower the levels. He quickly obliges.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Yes I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: BIJOU
dialogues.text: (nervously) Um. Well...it’s kinda, um, embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Spit it out Bijou.

dialogues.speaker: BIJOU
dialogues.text: That's the problem. I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Oh. Getting a little extra protein in your diet, huh?

dialogues.speaker: BIJOU
dialogues.text: (breaking up) My stomach’s been killing me ever since. Sasha, I think I can feel them swimming around in there. Do I need to get my stomach pumped?

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Bijou, I think the only thing you need pumped is the air out of your head. Swallowing is a major safe sex no-no. Now, sounds to me like there’s nothing wrong with your stomach that a shot of Pepto wouldn’t cure. Don’t stress and next time make sure to climb off that volcano before it erupts. Next caller.  18 ll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The campus coffee shop. Over the radio, Sasha’s radio sho is PLAYING. Natalie and Brenda sit in couches next to a CRACKLING fireplace along with two guys, PARKER and PAUL. Notepads and textbooks fill the table in front of them. Natalie turns to PARKER, older than the others and wearin Sigma Epsilon sweatshirt. Parker has been at Pendelton fo seven years and has no intention on graduating just yet. bother dealing with real responsibility when you're the b known party guy on campus?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Parker, how exactly does Sasha come up with this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: She devours every issue of Cosmo. Calls it her bible. BRENDA (cont'd) (anxious) So, finish the story.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Anyway, he was a professor on campus. Maybe twenty-five, thirty years ago.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: What did he teach?

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: I don't know...biology or something. PAUL, the sexy and soft-spoken journalist, sits next to Brenda. He’s quiet and listens intently. The kind of guy who seems to be able to read you with one glance.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: It was actually abnormal psychology from what I understand.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Not the point of the story, but fine, abnormal psych it is. Anyway, he flipped out one night. Went completely berserk. Grabbed his hunting knife and headed into Stanley Hall. Banged on every door. And every student that answered, he took that knife and slit their throats. Ear to ear. (CONTINUED)

18 He demonstrates it with a butter knife. PARKER (cont'd) Did away with an entire floor before stabbing himself straight through the heart. Again, he demonstrates with the butter knife. The group PARKER (cont‘d) UGGH...thus the annual Sigma Epsilon bash.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: You have a frat party to commemorate a massacre?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Any excuse to get plastered.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: (grinning broadly) You betcha.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: So Parker when this happened, you were, what, a sophomore here? laughs.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: You can laugh but like I’ve said before, I really see no point in graduating before thirty.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: What do you think Natalie? You buy it?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: A massacre? Of course not. It’s a bullshit story you hear on every campus in the Northeast. Show me the proof.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Well, that’s the thing. Pendelton knew enrollment would suffer permanently, so, in cahoots with the national news media and various, other, powerful organizations...they’ve done their best to eliminate any information relating to it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m so sure. Suddenly there’s loud BEEPING. Paul checks his pager.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Just a sec. He stands up and brushes against Brenda. She eyes him longingly. Brenda turns to Natalie as he walks away.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Did you see how he brushed against my leg?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Slowly. Like a seduction.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I say he’s into it.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: I don‘t know. He’s good-looking, smart, straight. Not the type that usually goes for me.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Brenda, stop being so down on yourself. The leg brush...it’s a sign.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Should I ask him out?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Let him come to you.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Yo! Don’t mind including me in some of your chick banter. Paul walks back.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Something’s come up. -I gotta get to the newsroom.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Another e-coli crisis in the cafeteria? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I wish. That one almost got me the student Pulitzer. He winks at her, smiles and exits.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Bye!

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Okay guys, I've got a scary story too. The group of lazy college kids who flunked out and ended up making blizzards at Dairy Queen. She opens up her book. Parker and Brenda GROAN in unison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is fumbling with her keys. Suddenly, the door swi open taking Natalie aback. Holding the door is a wrinkled gray-haired JANITOR with a friendly demeanor.

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: There you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie walks in.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Thanks so much.

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: (smiling) Oh no problem at all. Just finishing cleaning up. We catch a glimpse of the tiny computer room he’s cleanin

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Well good night. He smiles at her and goes back into the room. INT. NATALIE’ S ROOM - NIGHT. 21 It’s dark inside. The door CREAKS open...Natalie entering She feels around the wall for the light switch. She hits as she-shuts the door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TOSH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: SHUT OFF THE FUCKING LIGHT
dialogues.text: She‘turns to find TOSH, her gothic, manic-depressive room in bed with a guy. We see the room. Natalie’s half is neat and clean. The walls of Tosh’s half are painted black and Marilyn Manson posters hang from the wall. It’s a sty.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Sorry. She turns off the light. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - NIGHT. ‘ 22 Natalie lies in bed, looking away as Tosh and the guy MOA ecstasy. She grabs her pillow and covers her ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, auditorium style room. On the chalkboard it read “Intro to American Folklore.” The class is restless...no sign of the instructor. In the middle of the classroom si Natalie and Brenda. Behind them, Parker and Damon. Parker eating a bagel and a brown PAPER BAG sits on his desk. Da is staring at the overhead clock. It reads, “9:09.”

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, it’s ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Bud, I’ve been here six years. If the professor has tenure, which Wexler does, you wait twenty minutes. If not, ten’s the max.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: (looking at clock) 5-4-3-2-1...outta here. He stands up. Just as he does, the door swings open. . PROFESSOR WEXLER, middle-aged and wearing an obvious toup walks in. He sees Damon.

dialogues.speaker: PROF. WEXLER
dialogues.text: Going somewhere Damon? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAMON .
dialogues.text: Me? No. Just stretching. He stretches his arms exaggeratedly and sits back down.

dialogues.speaker: PROF. WEXLER
dialogues.text: Good. Lights please. The eager TEACHER'S ASSISTANT hits the lights and turns o the slide machine. PROF. WEXLER (cont ’d) Last week we discussed folklore as a gauge for the values and concerns of the society that created them. Today we get more specific. The slide machine CLICKS to a spooky drawing of a darkene living room. In the background, a man in shadow is walkin down a staircase while a frightened and oblivious teenage girl sits on a couch, phone up to her ear. PROF. WEXLER (cont'd) A baby-sitter receives menacing phone calls and upon tracing them, realizes they're originating from the upstairs room. The room where she’s left the children under her care to sleep. Who's heard this before? Most of the class raises their hands.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: That really happened to a girl in my old town.

dialogues.speaker: PROF. WEXLER
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Yes, I’m sure it did. I’m sure most of you think this happened to girls in all of your hometowns. But it didn’t. The baby-sitter and the man upstairs is an urban legend, contemporary folklore passed on as a true story. There are variations of this tale dating back to the 60’s. All of them containing the same cultural admonition: young women, mind your children or harm will come your way. Damon leans over and whispers in Natalie’s ear. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: — DAMON What's the chance that a better head rug will come his way? Natalie LAUGHS. Wexler turns around and sees her.

dialogues.speaker: PROF. WEXLER
dialogues.text: Something funny you’d like to share with us Natalie?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: No Mr. Wexler. He stares at her hard.

dialogues.speaker: PROF. WEXLER
dialogues.text: Well then, why don’t you come down here and volunteer for my experiment.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Experiment?

dialogues.speaker: PROF. WEXLER
dialogues.text: Don't worry. You'll probably survive. Natalie takes a deep breath and stands up. She looks back ~ find Damon and Parker trying to conceal their laughter.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT OF THE CLASS
dialogues.text: Wexler hands Natalie a packet of Pop Rocks.

dialogues.speaker: PROF. WEXLER
dialogues.text: Had these before?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Pop Rocks? Sure. They crackle in your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: PROF. WEXLER
dialogues.text: Eat some. She pours the candy into her mouth. It’s POPPING. : PROF. WEXLER (cont ’d) Thirsty? Wexler holds out a can of Coke. Natalie instinctively spi out. .

dialogues.speaker: WEXLER
dialogues.text: . Is there something you might have heard ~ about mixing pop rocks and coke? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Well, supposedly your stomach, intestines, everything...bursts.

dialogues.speaker: WEXLER
dialogues.text: Really? Anyone you know died this way?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Mikey. From the Life cereal commercial. You know, “Give it to Mikey. He’ll eat anything.” The slide machine CLICKS. A still of Mikey from the commercial appears.

dialogues.speaker: WEXLER
dialogues.text: You mean him.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Another CLICK. A picture of a smiling, middle-aged man appears on screen. WEXLER (cont'd) What if I told you this is Mikey today. Alive and well and working as an ad executive in New York. Would you eat it then? Natalie looks around the class. All eyes on her.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I think I'll pass. Wexler looks disappointed. Suddenly Damon stands up.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: I'll do it! Damon walks down and grabs the Pop Rocks. He swallows it down with a swig of Coke. He’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: WEXLER
dialogues.text: Again, nothing more than an urban legend. Suddenly, Damon falls to the floor. The class GASPS. He’s spasming uncontrollably as pop rocks drool down the side his mouth. Parker jumps up from his seat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: HE’S GONNA EXPLODE! Brenda SCREAMS and runs out of the room. BOOM! It sounds like something’s burst. The entire class stands and stare at Damon who suddenly jumps up and laughs hysterically. H pulls out the paper bag he was hiding under his coat. The class bursts into LAUGHTER. Wexler shakes his head an rolls his eyes. PROF. WEXLER (cont'd) All right children, shall we move on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie and Brenda step out from the classroom building.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: You actually thought Damon was going to explode.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Well I didn’t want to take the chance of getting intestinal splatter on my outfit. They turn a corner and stop dead in their tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of police cars are parked in front of the studen union. Over by the newsstand, a crowd has gathered. BRENDA (cont'd) What's going on? Natalie shrugs her shoulders. As they walk towards the crowd, a passing GIRL drops a copy of the Pendelton Daily newspaper. Natalie picks it up. On the front page is a huge, New York Post style headline that reads, “IS THERE LUNATIC ON CAMPUS?" There’s a big picture of Michelle Mancini in the middle. NATALIE stares at the paper, shocked. . BRENDA (cont'd) (freaking ‘out) You’ve gotta be kidding me! I knew I should've gone to NYU.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (proud) Can you believe the trouble I’m causing? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They turn around and find Paul behind them.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Hi Paul... He smiles at her for a second before something catches hi eye over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patrician, middle-aged college dean, ROGER ADAMS, is standing on the steps of the student union, clutching a c of the newspaper. Next to him is a young, black woman ina security uniform. This is REESE, campus head of security. She has a determined, intense look in her eyes. The Dean turns to a couple of young INTERNS and whispers them. They immediately walk down and through the crowd an begin confiscating the papers from the newstand.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Hey! He runs over to the interns. PAUL (cont‘d) What the hell are you doing? They ignore him. He looks at the Dean and runs over to hi PAUL (cont'd) You can’t just seize every copy here! The Dean stares at him harshly.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: You‘re the one that wrote this misconstrued, sensationalistic piece of rubbish, didn’t you?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Sure did.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something young man, as far as I’m concerned, the only lunatic on this campus is you.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I'm...flattered. He takes out his tape recorder. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PAUL (cont'd) May I quote you on that? The Dean rolls his eyes and walks away. Reese steps up to the recorder.

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: I have a comment. U.S. News & World Report named Pendelton the safest university in the country. I call it the safest university in the Western Hemisphere and I intend to keep it that way with or without your help. She turns around and follows the Dean.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Thank you Reese. He turns to Natalie and Brenda. PAUL (cont'd) Well I guess I’m on the administration hit list again.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (to Brenda) Let’s get out of here. Paul turns to Natalie and Brenda and holds up his recorde

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Wait! how about some interviews? Students reacts to tragedy on campus.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: {forcing it; into recorder) Today, I am deeply saddened and moved by the sudden death --

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Come on. Natalie grabs Brenda and drags her away.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: See ya. . (she turns to Natalie) Tell me you noticed him licking his lips when he looked at me.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Major lickage. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Yes. Brenda jerks her arms back victoriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull back from the television where a NEWSMAN is discussing the murder.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSMAN
dialogues.text: ...The police are still searching for the proprietor of the gas station. Brenda, Natalie, Damon, Parker and Sasha are sitting arou Parker has his arm around Sasha. Natalie is staring off i space.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: (moved) Someone told me her radio was tuned to my show when it happened. My voice was probably the last thing she heard. Can you imagine?

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Yeah, one minute you’ve finally figured out where your g-spot is, the next your head is too far away to see it. He starts laughing.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Hysterical, dumb ass.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: What if there is a lunatic on campus?

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Fine with me, I’m hitting the slopes this weekend. .

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: I heard the girl’s body kept driving by itself even though it had no head.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Yeah, avd it pulled into a Taco Bell drive-tnrough for dinner. The group laughs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Anyone here know her? Everyone shakes their heads, “no.” Natalie isn’t even listening. Brenda snaps her fingers in front of her face. BRENDA (cont'd) Hello...space cadet.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: No, I didn’t know her.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Hey, I heard the dead girl gave good head. Get it? He grabs his head and pulls it back and forth. DAMON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: SHE GAVE GOOD HEAD
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs except for Natalie. EXT. NATALIE’S DORM - DUSK. 26 A faint orange glow lingers on the residence hall as the disappears. Students are heading back to their rooms. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - NIGHT. 27 Natalie walks in. Heavy industrial music is BLASTING. Tos decked out in black, is sitting at her desk, typing on th computer and chain-smoking.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Hey Tosh. Sorry about last night. Tosh looks at her nastily.

dialogues.speaker: TOSH
dialogues.text: Yeah well, don’t let it happen again. Natalie puts down her things. She notices a spilled bottl of pills on the floor. She kneels and picks it up. It’sa bottle of “Prozac.”

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I think these are yours. Natalie tosses it to Tosh who swallows one of the pills. Natalie picks up the phone. We hear the staticky HISS of computer modem. Tosh is online. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Tosh?

dialogues.speaker: TOSH
dialogues.text: (annoyed) What?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I need to check my voice-mail. Do you mind getting off-line for a minute?

dialogues.speaker: TOSH
dialogues.text: (angry) Okay, but this is my phone line too... She turns off the computer. We hear the familiar America Online “Goodbye.” She storms out of the place. Natalie holds back her anger and shuts off the grating music. She dials the voice mail and puts the phone on speaker.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA., (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey it’s Brenda. Cardio funk hip-hop aerobics tonight? Call me. Natalie looks at herself in the mirror. Hanging off the s of it is a blue and gold tassel like Michelle Mancini had the car. Natalie looks away. She takes her coat off and goes to the closet to hang it. The answering machine BEEP

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Natalie...I heard. Everyone's talking about it around town. What is going on up there? You better be carrying the Shrieker with you at all times. ALL TIMES. Natalie smiles to herself. She stops and kneels, picking packet up from the bottom of the closet. On it is a very 80's looking picture of a heavily made up girl being attacked, and holding up “The Shrieker” screaming device. She takes the device out of the box and sticks it in her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Better yet, maybe you should pack a bag and come home for the weekend. Call me. The machine BEEPS. As she’s about to close the closet doo she looks up at the top shelf and sees her old high schoo yearbook. She stares at it for a moment, then takes it ou She walks over to her desk, sits, and opens it up.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A picture of the cheerleading squad. We see Michelle Manc and Natalie standing right next to each other. She turns the page. Candid shots. One of them is Natalie and’Michelle, eating ice cream, their boyfriends behind t CLOSE ON Natalie’s face. She’s in tears. There’s a knock the door. Damon.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Hey! I was just in the neighborhood. Thought I’d pop by and see if you want to go hang out at the house. Parker’s gonna pierce Hootie’s nose.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Hootie’s a dog.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: No reason he can’t be hip.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: That’s okay Damon. He notices the tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: What's going on? You all right?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: You sure? Listen, we don’t have to go hang out with a bunch of drunk frat guys...we can go somewhere and just talk.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (not sure) Um... He grabs her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: I'm a great listener you know. Natalie looks at him. Maybe he’s not such a slimeball aft all. INT. DAMON’ S CAR - NIGHT. 28 Damon jumps in. He offers her a beer.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Want a little something to warm you up?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Sure. He hands her a beer and tries to start the car...it doesn

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Slight process. He moves the steering wheel around, pumps the gas and the engine ROARS.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: There we go. He drives off. EXT. LAKESIDE - NIGHT. » 29 A small lake in the wooded area separating the campus fro the town. On the other side, we can see school buildings. full moon shines ominously, illuminating the water. We se sports car parked under a tree near the edge of the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few beer bottles are strewn on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: So you and Michelle were like best friends? Natalie nods. DAMON (cont ‘d) So why haven't you spoken to each other in two years? Natalie stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I'd kinda prefer not to talk about it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: You don’t wanna open up. Completely understandable. But I gotta tell ya...I know exactly what you're going through.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: You do? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: (sounding meaningful) Sure. I lost someone close to me once. My girlfriend. She...died. He covers his face with his hands. Natalie puts her arm around him.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: It's okay. She was sick for awhile...had a (reaching)...syndrome. I was afraid to get close to anybody again after that. And then, one day, it hit me. Why am I being so selfish? I have so much love inside of me to give.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (figuring out his game) You do? DAMON (cont'd) MmmHmmm. And Natalie...you're in need of loving.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I am?

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Yup. You’re lonely. Repressed. Aching to break loose. Kinda things only a man can fix.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: And I suppose you're this man?

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: You know: it. Damon stares at her then tries to kiss her. She pushes hi off. . NATALIE (cont'd) What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Don’t be afraid to love Natalie. You don’t have to be afraid anymore. He tries to kiss her again, a little more forcefully. She swings and punches him in the face. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DAMON (cont'd) Ouch!

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Drive me home Damon.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Fuck, I’m just tryin’ to help you out. You don‘t have to act like such a freakin’ bitch.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: You asshole. Just start the car.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: You sure you don’t want to think about this? I’m all about healing Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: One black eye or two Damon, you decide. Start the car.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: (pissed) Hold on. I gotta take a leak. He steps outside.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (to herself) Pig. She doesn’t look well. She opens up the vanity mirror.

dialogues.speaker: MIRROR
dialogues.text: She stares at herself for a second. As she goes to close mirror, we catch a quick, unclear reflection of something outside. Natalie doesn’t notice. She’s waiting, looking impatient. Finally, she opens her door and steps out.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Damon, hurry up and let’s go. She walks backwards looking around. As she reaches the ba of the car, she turns to look forward and comes face to f with... THE KILLER. His hood is tight around his face making it impossible to make out who it is. Natalie GASPS. She star backing away, fumbling in her pocket. She pulls out the (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: “shrieker.” It SHRIEKS for barely a second before it’s ju hissing air. She throws it at him and runs into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She locks the doors. Turns around. The back window is ope As she reaches back to shut it, a GLOVED HAND grabs her h from outside and starts reaching inside, trying to unlock door. Natalie grabs the keys from the ignition and stabs his ha The killer falls back and Natalie is able to shut the win NATALIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: She HONKS the horn, then: BOOM! From above. She stops honking. BOOM! She looks up. The roof of the car is denting...someone's walking on it. She tries starting the car. It won't. BOOM! A dent right above her head. Natalie reclines the seat back. She’s shaking. She stares up at the roof. It’s silent. Then, we begin to hear a low, steady sound. It’s getting louder and louder. SCRATCHING. Natalie is dumbfounded. It’s furious now. Like he’s trying to scratc his way inside the car. She jumps up and again tries the car. As we hear the engine choking, we PAN UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see bare feet furiously scratching the roof. Then as w go up further we realize it’s Damon. He’s hung by a rope. keeps himself from being choked by holding onto his neck. can barely get his words out...

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: (breathlessly) Don’t start the car! Don’t start the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is still feverishly attempting to get the car started. The SCRATCHING even more furious than before. Natalie stops to catch her breath. She looks out the wind Presses her face against the glass, attempting to see wha happening on the roof, when suddenly... THE KILLER'S HEAD pops down from over the car, right in f of her,

dialogues.speaker: AAAAAAHHHHH
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Natalie jumps back into her seat, adrenaline rushing, and suddenly remembers the trick to starting the car. She mov the steering wheel, pumps the gas, tries the ignition...T ENGINE ROARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon's face is aghast.

dialogues.speaker: NOOO
dialogues.text: The car zooms away. We hear Damon's neck CRACK as his eye go blank and he’s pulled up towards the tree. We now see that the end of the rope is tied to the back of his car. INT. DAMON’S CAR - NIGHT. 36 Natalie SCREAMS as the KILLER lands on the front hood of car. He’s holding on to the windshield wipers. She jerks the car to throw him off. Suddenly, the car won’t move an further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the tensed up rope not allowing the car to go forw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is shaking as The killer lurches up towards the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DASHBOARD
dialogues.text: We see the RPM’s going into the red as Natalie hits the accelerator as far as it can go.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: The killer’s moved up to the windshield. He starts kickin it in with his boots. The glass is CRACKING. Natalie looks down at the gear shift, slams it into rever She stares straight at the killer.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Fuck you. She hits the accelerator. The killer goes flying off the car.  39 40 41 42 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rope behind the car is slacking.

dialogues.speaker: TREE BRANCH
dialogues.text: Damon's body quickly starts to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie, out of breath, is looking back and doesn’t notic DAMON’S BODY through the windshield, falling straight towards her.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH
dialogues.text: Damon's body CRASHES through the windshield landing right top of Natalie. NATALIE (cont ‘d)

dialogues.speaker: NOOOOO
dialogues.text: The car stops moving. Glass covers the front. Natalie tri pushing Damon off, but he’s heavy. She manages to get out from under him and open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She falls out of the car and looks around. No sign of the killer. She gets up and runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the wall hangs a large “Foxy Brown” poster with Pam Gr We hear a couple arguing 0.S. We track to a desk where Re is watching “Coffy,” another Pam Grier classic. Reese kno every line and delivers it with as much vigor as Pam.

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: This is the end of your rotten life you motherfuckin’ dope pusher! A shotgun BLAST followed by typical blaxploitation MUSIC. Reese holds up her small, standard issue gun and pretends shoot. . REESE (cont‘d) It was easy for him because he really didn’t believe it was coming, but it ain’t gonna be easy for you, ‘cause you better believe that it’s coming. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly there's loud BANGING on the door. Reese rolls he eyes at the interruption...her favorite scene. She opens door. Natalie is standing in front of her, distraught and shaking. REESE (cont'd) Girl what is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (hysterical) They killed him! Somebody killed him! Reese stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reese is driving in the woods as Natalie sits, shaking. Reese caresses her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: Honey, everything's gonna be all right now. You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Turn here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reese turns off the main road into a dirt path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie turns to Reese. NATALIE (cont'd) Up ahead. She closes her eyes. Reese stops the car.

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: Here? Natalie looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERE’S NOTHING THERE. She steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks around. It’s the same spot. Reese climbs out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (stammering) I-I don’t get it...

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: If you don’t mind me asking...WHAT THE

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Nothing! We were parked right here. Reese kneels down and picks up an empty beer bottle.

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: Right here, huh?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Reese, I’m not crazy. I know what I saw. It’s probably the same person who killed Michelle Mancini!

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: That's impossible. The police arrested the gas station attendant this evening. Natalie is speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda, Paul, Sasha and Parker are sitting around Natalie hasn't slept all night and looks it. Parker’s trying to h back his laughter.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Sorry. It’s just that, you've been had Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (pissed) He was dead when he crashed through the windshield Parker, this is no joke.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Trust me, he’s my frat brother and the best practical joker on campus. He once convinced a freshman he was the middle Hanson brother just so he could get laid.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: So where is he? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Parker pulls out a paper with a phone number and the head ~ “Blair Mountain Ski Resort.”

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Weekend ski trip with his buddies from back home.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Then where’s his car?

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: He drove. A realization comes over Parker. PARKER (cont‘d) Scratching on the roof of the car...don’t you get it? It’s just like the urban legend.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: What urban legend?

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Wexler talks about it every semester. Guy —~ and girl. Parked in the woods making out. Guy steps out. Girl hears spooky ~ scratching noises on the roof...it’s her dead boyfriend, hung from the tree.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: And he was murdered. Remember? Brenda is breathing heavily now.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: I'm starting to feel an anxiety attack coming on.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Calm down. He puts his hand on her knee. She looks at the hand then winks at Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: . SASHA
dialogues.text: Wait a second. That totally happened to my sister’s ex-boyfriend's cousin. Except he was hung from his feet and scratching with his nails. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a variation babe. There's dozens of them. Thus the windshield stunt. (to Natalie) Tell me, what was this killer wearing?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: A black parka.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: With a furry hood? Natalie nods. Parker laughs. PARKER (cont’‘d) His Nanook of the North spook outfit. Look, Damon’s in the class. He knew the myth. He must've planned the whole thing out. Conniving bastard. Something hits Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Wait a second. There’s an urban legend 7 about a lunatic with an ax hiding ina woman's backseat.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Hello, my mom still checks the backseat before getting into a car.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: That’s how Michelle Mancini died. Everyone stops arid stares at her. NATALIE (cont'd) It's almost like someone out there is taking these folk tales, our urban legends...and making them reality. Everyone is silent. Finally, the group bursts into uncontrollable LAUGHTER. Natalie looks angry.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Who knew Ms. Skepticism herself would envision such a daring concept. Parker turns to Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Call Damon. You’ll see. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE PAPER
dialogues.text: Natalie stares hard at it. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - DAY. 48 Natalie walks in. Tosh is online again. She looks like sh hasn't stepped out of the room in days.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Tosh, do you mind if I -- Tosh turns around.

dialogues.speaker: TOSH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Nevermind. She walks out. ON THE COMPUTER SCREEN, we see that Tosh is in an America Online chat room called "Goth 4 Goth.” Her screen name is Forlorn22. She types, “Gothic guys on campus lookin’ to h up...IM me.” She takes a long drag off her cigarette and waits for a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is on a payphone outside.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That group is in one of our phone-free cabins.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Did they check in?

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Oh, sure they did.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I need to know if a specific guest, Damon Brooks, is in that group.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (typing) Well...the cabin is not registered under his name and we really have no way of knowing exactly who’s in there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Can I leave a message at the front desk?

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Sure you can...but I can’t guarantee that they'll stop by to pick it up. Natalie looks defeated as she hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tall, brownstone structure towering over the campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and musty with no windows. Half the bulbs are burnt out, darkening some of the aisles more than others. Natal slowly walks through the maze of bookstacks, searching th stacks.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND HER
dialogues.text: A SHADOW moves in the distance. Natalie spins around. Did she see something? Just her imagination. She gets back to scanning. Suddenly we hear distinct FOOTSTEPS. Natalie stops in her tracks and looks around. The air is heavy wi dust.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Hello? No answer. She looks up one end of the narrow aisle then other. We hear the THUD of a book drop. It could be anywhere. NATALIE (cont ‘d) Is there someone there? Silence. She turns around. Directly in front of her is th book she’s been searching for, “Encyclopedia of Urban Legends.” It’s a heavy volume. She grabs it with both han and pulls it out revealing... EYES, staring right at her. Natalie SCREAMS and jumps bac against the shelves, knocking some books down.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don’t freak out on me. Sasha walks around and over to Natalie. She’s holding an old, worn book. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SASHA (cont'd) I've been looking for this everywhere. An early printing of the “Kama Sutra”... with illustrations. You think Parker will get into it?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Does your sexual guinea pig have a choice?

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: No. {A Pause) What's that? Natalie hesitantly shows it to her. SASHA (cont'd) Encyclopedia of Urban Legends. Oh Natalie, don’t tell me you still think--

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know Sasha.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Well let's take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie and Sasha are sitting down going over the urban legends book. Some of the pages are illustrated. Natalie turns to “The Boyfriend’s Death.” It resembles how Damon killed.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: This is it. Sasha grabs the book and looks.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Hmm. Scary. She flips a page. SASHA (cont'd) Wait a second, this is definitely not an urban legend.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: The gang high-beam initiation. Happens all the time. Gang members drive around at night with their headlights off at and when someone flashes their high beams to warn them, they kill ‘em. So gruesome. Natalie snatches the book from her hand. SASHA (cont'd) That's why I never warn anyone about anything when I drive. Natalie stares heavily at the book. SASHA (cont‘d) Hello? Are you listening to me? Anyway, I'm going. Gotta get started practicing this. She holds up the Kama Sutra book.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Bye Sasha.

dialogues.speaker: BOOK
dialogues.text: We see the illustration of the “Gang High-Beam Initiation CLOSE ON NATALIE’S EYES This story is obviously hitting a chord. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - NIGHT. 53 Tosh is still waiting for a response. The ashtray on her desk is overflowing with cigarette butts. Suddenly we hea RING. There’s a message from a “Gloomy4U.” It reads, “We' on similar dark paths.” Tosh types, “What U into?” His response: “Lithium.” A smile cracks across her face. She types, “My type of gu with a little sideways happy face :)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is still looking over the book when, suddenly, th overhead lights start to blink. Natalie jumps. The LIBRAR ATTENDANT is standing at the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: . LIBRARY ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: We’re closing in fifteen minutes, guys. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Natalie shuts the book. On the back is a paper with the names of the last few people to have checked it out. The most recent reads, “Damon Brooks.” She shakes her head...maybe it is some kind of sick joke. She gets up to leave. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - NIGHT. 55 Tosh is getting excited. “Where u at?” She types. “Close. is his response. “Tease,” she types. “Gonna get ready. Let me know what room U R in.” She gets up, grabs her makeup bag and runs out of the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is walking back to her dorm on one of the cobbles walkways that zigzag through campus. There’s a few street lights scattered about. It’s desolate. She walks more hurriedly. A FIGURE suddenly appears from behind Natalie, sideswiping her. She jumps. It’s only a JOGGER.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Watch out!

dialogues.speaker: JOGGER
dialogues.text: (mumbling) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tosh is in front of the mirror, hurriedly applying makeup Smeared black mascara, black eyeliner, white face powder, etc. She runs back into the room. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - NIGHT. 58 She sits at her desk again and looks at the computer scre She rereads her last message, “Tell me what room U R in.” Pan down to the response. “Yours.” Suddenly, THE KILLER appears behind her. He covers her mo with his gloved hand. We hear her muffled SCREAM as she struggles to break loos She tries typing “help” on the computer screen. The kille hits a button and shuts off the computer. Before it goes black, we hear the America Online “GOODBYE.” The killer rolls Tosh in her desk chair over to her bed. She tries t get up, but he knocks her down. He grabs her pillow and covers her face. Her screams sound like MOANING.  s9 60 61 41.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, RESIDENCE HALL
dialogues.text: Natalie is walking into her residence hall, when a BITCHY GIRL walks out.

dialogues.speaker: BITCHY GIRL
dialogues.text: Hmm...sounds like Elvira’s raising more than the dead in there.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Thanks for the warning. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - NIGHT. 60 Tosh is GASPING for air. We hear the sound of the KEY IN LOCK. THE KILLER grabs the lamp cord and unplugs it. It’s completely dark now. THE DOOR swings open.

dialogues.speaker: WALL
dialogues.text: Natalie is feeling for the light switch. She’s almost reached it when...she hears the MOANING. She opts against it. CLOSE ON TOSH. Her violent jerking can be mistaken for something else. Natalie lock the door once, then, after some thought, loc again. She makes her way through the room in the dark, accidently bumping into Tosh’s bed.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (whispering) Sorry. Not looking. Natalie climbs into bed, covering her ears with the pillo

dialogues.speaker: TOSH
dialogues.text: The life goes out of her. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - MORNING. 61 Sunlight is pouring into the room. Natalie slowly wakes u She stretches her arms, opens her eyes. Her vision is groggy. She notices writing on the wall across from her. Her vision slowly starts to come into focus. She makes ou the word “Aren’t.” She’s dumbfounded. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Aren’t... There’s more. NATALIE (cont‘d) You...glad...you...didn’t...turn on the light? It's written in dripping blood. NATALIE (cont‘d) Tosh? She turns to her side and finds... a ghastly TOSH, her wrists slit, lying in bed staring straight at Natalie. NATALIE (cont’d)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is sitting down surrounded by Dean Adams, Reese a couple of COPS. The door is open and Natalie, eyes glazed is staring out at Tosh’s covered body being wheeled off b PARAMEDIC. The bitchy girl stands against the wall watching.

dialogues.speaker: BITCHY GIRL
dialogues.text: (to paramedic) You better check her pulse...she’s looked like that for years. Brenda appears at the door. She looks concerned and waves Natalie. Natalie waves back.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: Natalie? She turns to him. DEAN ADAMS (cont'd) Some water? He hands her a glass of water and sits in. front. of her.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Thank you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: So you heard moaning when you walked in. Why didn't you turn on the lights?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I'd walked in on Tosh having sex before. It wasn’t something I cared to see again.

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: So you never actually saw anyone there?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: No. The Dean and Reese look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: Natalie did you know Tosh was manic- depressive? He holds up the bottle of Prozac.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: She painted half the room black. I hada good idea.

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: There’s no signs of foul play here. No forced entry. No signs of a struggle. No witnesses.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: This appears to be a very tragic...suicide.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (disbelieving) Tosh did not kill herself. There was someone else in that room. “Aren’t you glad you didn’t turn on the lights” for Christ's sake!

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: A very morbid...suicide note. Dead silence. The Dean compassionately places his hand on Natalie's lap. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: Look, I’m having someone come in right now and hold a counseling session with the rest of the dorm. It might be a good idea for you to sit in. Natalie stares at the Dean and Reese. We track behind her towards one of the computer terminals. On the screen is t America Online sign-off message. It reads, “Goodbye Gloomy4u.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda and Natalie are slowly walking up towards the dorm common area.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Natalie, maybe Tosh just couldn’t deal with life anymore.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Tosh could never deal with life...she just wouldn't kill herself. I don’t understand what’s happening Brenda.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Maybe this counselor isn’t such a bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Have you ever been in therapy?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Did it help?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: No. But it makes for great conversation at parties. . Brenda smiles and Natalie forces one out too. They reach entrance to the common room and pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few students are gathered in a circle around ‘a late tw something counselor, DOUG. He's wearing a white turtle ne under a sweater and has a calm, involved look on his face Everyone else looks disinterested and bored. In the background we hear ENYA playing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: .-This is all about compassion, dialogue, mutual support -- All eyes turn to Natalie. He stops mid-sentence and looks back. A wave of sympathy and emotion rolls over him. DOUG (cont’d) You must be the roommate. Come here sweetheart. She slowly walks towards him. He speeds things up and gra her, hugging her tightly. He closes his eyes. DOUG (cont'd) Ooze it all out...right on me, don’t be afraid. CLOSE ON NATALIE'’S FACE This isn’t what she needs right now. Doug turns to Brenda DOUG (cont'd) Do you need to ooze too?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (waving hands) Oh no, I’m all oozed up. He grabs Natalie’s hand and sits her down. Brenda follows

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Just sit right here. We’re discussing just what Tosh meant to each of us. Who has the talking stick? A WHOLESOME GIRL raises her hand, clutching onto a wooden stick. . DOUG (cont‘d) You go ahead angel.

dialogues.speaker: WHOLESOME GIRL
dialogues.text: (upset) Well...one time Tosh threatened to gouge my eyes out if I didn’t stop blasting my Amy Grant CD. I thought she was really mean...but now I know it was only a cry for help. She starts crying. He pats her back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: There, there. Which album?

dialogues.speaker: WHOLESOME GIRL
dialogues.text: (through tears) “Heart and Motion” He smiles sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I really like that one. (a pause) Anyone else have anything to say about Tosh? THE GROUP could care less about Tosh. DOUG (cont’d) You? He grabs the talking stick and hands it to a PREPPY GUY.

dialogues.speaker: PREPPY GUY
dialogues.text: Um. I didn’t know her.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: It seems that way now...to all of us, doesn’t it? Like we never really knew the real Tosh. Such is the depth of the human soul.

dialogues.speaker: PREPPY GUY
dialogues.text: No. I just didn’t know her. Never met her in my life. Doug angrily grabs the stick from his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Anyone else? Natalie? He tries handing her the stick. DOUG (cont'd) You wanna grab the stick? Brenda looks to Natalie. All eyes are on her. This is too much to handle. .

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I just wanna be alone right now. She stands up and walks out of the room. A BITTER GIRL tu to the group. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BITTER GIRL
dialogues.text: What's she so upset about...she’s the one getting a 4.0 this semester.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: So...anyone up for a little role playing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie runs out of her dorm. She stops on the front step and catches her breath. She sits down and shuts her eyes, completely overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. She looks up. Paul is standing in front of her, holding o his tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Sorry Paul, I'm not doing any interviews. He sticks the recorder in his pocket and holds his hands

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Strictly off the record.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I think I’m going crazy.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Happens to the best of us. He sits down next to her. PAUL (cont’d) Did you see it coming?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Yes -- no. I mean...I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: This suicide note I heard about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren‘t you glad you didn’t turn on the light...in her blood. Paul looks away. Laughs.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: That’s weird. When I was a kid, I heard a story about a college girl who's (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PAUL (cont'd) roommate was murdered. The roommate walked in that night and went straight to bed. The next morning -- Natalie turns to him. Something hits her.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: An urban legend. Paul looks at her. NATALIE (cont’d) Paul, Tosh didn’t commit suicide. There was somebody else in there. It’s really happening. Something hits Paul.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Tonight’s the anniversary you know.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: What anniversary?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: The Stanley Hall massacre. If it really happened that is.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: How do we find out for sure? We pull up behind them and see Brenda in the upstairs win staring on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small single in the frat house. The blinds are drawn an Indian sitar music is PLAYING in the background. Sasha, dressed in sexy lingerie, is lighting candles around the while Parker lies shirtless in bed, anxiously awaiting whatever she has planned.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: So...what are we doin’?

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: It's a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hootie, a Yorkshire Terrier with a nose ring, is sitting the floor, staring up at her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: And Hootie is out of here.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Oh come on! He’s not bothering you.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Parker, he makes me uncomfortable. She opens the door, about to let him out.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: It’s all right boy. You'll be back ina few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: I only wish it lasted that long. Parker sneers at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A college version of the bustling newsroom. Reporters pil on top of each other typing on old computers or talking o the phone. Paul and Natalie walk in.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: We have an archive with every issue of the Pendelton Daily that’s ever been published. If there was a massacre on campus you can bet it’s in there.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: So this is where you come up with your lurid articles. .

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I don’t come up with them. They just happen. Only thing I do is spice them up, add a little intrigue...make ‘em better. Nothing wrong with that.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Well you’ve managed to convince yourself.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Only way to survive. Over there. He points to a wooden door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 68 SQ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dimly lit room lined with large stacks. Natalie and Pau are staring at an empty space in one of the shelves.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I can’t believe this. They’re gone.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: They wouldn’t be anywhere else?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Nowhere I'd know of. They're startled by a CREAK. They turn and find the janit mopping up. PAUL (cont'd) Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: How long you been working at Pendelton?

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: Oh, started in ‘69, so almost thirty years now. Paul and Natalie look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Can you tell us what happened at Stanley Hall? . The janitor suddenly looks uncomfortable. He looks away.

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Did people die there?

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: I can’t help you with that.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Look, this is very important. We need to know if it’s true or not. This is clearly not something the janitor wants to discus (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: Talk to Professor Wexler.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: He knows more than I do. But don’t tell anyone I said anything. He grabs his bucket and mop and walks out. Paul and Natal look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Natalie are storming out when, suddenly, Brenda appears in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Hey guys! What’s up? I was just passing by and --

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Brenda, I’1l talk to you later. Paul completely ignores her as him and Natalie walk out.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (yelling out) I'll be at the gym! She hushes, looking none too pleased with herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha and Parker, both nude, are completely entwined. The “Kama Sutra” book is propped up on the nightstand. Sasha writhing in ecstasy. Parker looks like he’s being crushed PARKER . Can’t we ever just do it like normal people?

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: (moaning) Parker, any expert will tell you the secret to long-lasting relationships is variety. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: I’m just saying, it wouldn’t hurt to get into the missionary position every now and then.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: We hear the faint sound of SCRATCHING. The door creaks op and Hootie walks in. He's GASPING. Having problems breathing. He walks over to the bed and jumps on. Parker turns and sees him. PARKER (cont'd) What's wrong? Hootie just stares at Parker, helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Sasha. Sasha...enough! Disengage. There’s something wrong with Hootie.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: He's just getting excited watching us. Now come on. Hootie is now GASPING heavily. Sasha and Parker both look him when... He COUGHS. Suddenly, a BLOODY FINGER flies out of his mou landing on Sasha's breast. SASHA (cont‘d)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is banging on Professor Wexler’s office door as Nata stands against the wall waiting.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: He should be here...it’s his office _ hours.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I don’t think Wexler’s much into student/teacher interaction. He tries the door. It’s unlocked. Paul heads inside. He motions for her to follow. She hesitates and then goes ahead.  72 73 $3. INT. PROF. WEXLER’S OFFICE - DAY. 72 It’s small and cluttered. A window looks onto the quad. Paul is snooping around.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (nervous) What if he shows up? He ignores her and points to another door.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: What do you think that leads to?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Paul we should go. He walks over and opens the door. A BLACK PARKA leaps out him. He jumps. It was hanging inside the door. They both laugh. He looks inside the closet and his smile quickly vanishes. PAUL (cont’d) Natalie... She walks over, looks inside and freezes.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSET
dialogues.text: Laying on the floor is AN AX. We hear FOOTSTEPS approachi and see A’ FIGURE’S outline in the door window. Paul pull her into the closet and closes the door. It doesn’t shut completely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They’re pressed up against each other. They look heavily into each other’s eyes. Wexler is in the room. We hear FOOTSTEPS as he walks to his desk. We hear him SHUFFLING with some papers. The closet door is slowly CREAKING open. They stare at th expanding crack. The FOOTSTEPS outside seem to be heading out. The front door opens and shuts.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (whispering) Is he gone? Paul looks out the crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: No one there. He nods. He opens the door slowly and they walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul closes the door behind him revealing... PROFESSOR WEXLER standing behind the door.

dialogues.speaker: PROF. WEXLER
dialogues.text: Lost something? They turn around and freeze.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: No. He looks at them menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: MY OFFICE
dialogues.text: Paul and Natalie run out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OVERWEIGHT GUY in a hurry dumps a soda cup on the gras

dialogues.speaker: REESE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (over a P.A.) You might wanna pick that up. He stops and turns to find Reese in her security car, tal over the loudspeaker. He nervously goes back and picks up the cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reese laughs to herself. Suddenly, Natalie and Paul burst through the doors of the nearby classroom building. She steps out of her car.

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: . Hey! What the hell?!?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Reese! It’s Wexler.

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 78 INT. DEAN'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: The Dean is sitting behind his desk, staring daggers at P and Natalie. Reese sits behind them, listening.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: (sympathetically) Now Natalie, I know you're dealing with a lot right now. Suicide --

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Tosh was murdered! He closes his eyes and tenses up for a second then looks and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: Why do you two insist on creating an unnecessary atmosphere of paranoia in my school? Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Tell us about Stanley Hall Dean. ~ Reese’s ears prick up.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: It‘s a...what do you call it? An urban legend. You hear that on every college campus.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: But it had to originate somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Was Wexler involved? The Dean is silent.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: Natalie, maybe you'd care to sheda little light on something I noticed on your file.

dialogues.speaker: . NATALIE
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: Your probation for reckless endangerment. No response from Natalie. Paul looks at her, eyebrow rais Ne (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: That was in high school.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: I know. Happened after you’d already been accepted to Pendelton. You're lucky. The admissions office might have not looked upon a criminal record very favorably otherwise. Would you care to elaborate? Natalie looks at Paul then at the Dean.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: No I wouldn't. That has nothing to do with what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: Natalie there is nothing happening except two, completely unrelated tragedies. Now, I want to be as supportive as possible, but you’re skating on thin ice right now. So I’m requesting you take an academic leave of absence through the end of the semester. It'll do you some good to deal with what’s happening, back home, with your family.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: So that’s it, that’s how you're going to handle this? By sending me away? The Dean is silent. Paul stands up.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL,
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: I’m not through yet. You‘re off the paper Paul. This institution's had enough of your inflammatory articles.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: What? You can’t do this! There’s something in the constitution called freedom of speech!

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: The constitution doesn’t protect someone who wrongfully yells “fire” in a crowded theater. And Paul, you’ve yelled fire one too many times on this campus. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DEAN ADAMS (cont'd) (a pause) Enjoy your weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is now completely obscured by storm clouds. Paul Natalie step out of the administration building. There's tense silence.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Reckless endangerment...we’re not exactly talking about running a stop sign here are we? No response from Natalie. PAUL (cont'd) Natalie, I just lost a lot in there following your lead. So, maybe I have a right to know a little about your past.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: It‘s not something I wanna discuss.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You don’t wanna discuss it. Okay. Do you want to discuss my career options without a body of writing samples? Because FYI Natalie, they’re kind of limited. :

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Paul, whatever happened, it doesn't change the fact that someone on this campus is killing people!

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: It doesn’t? I don’t know if I buy it anymore. Honestly, Natalie, I don’t know if I ever bought it.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (realizing) Just looking for the big story, huh?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You got it. But that’s over with. So...write a letter to the editor. He turns and walks away, leaving Natalie standing alone i the quad.  59. 80 INT. DEAN’S OFFICE - DAY. 80 The Dean is on the phone. Reese is waiting to speak to hi

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: (into phone) Oh yes, very, very well. Enrollment’s up this semester and we've got record admissions applications for next --

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: Dean Adams?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: (covering phone; serious) Just a second. (into phone) Okay. No, all that’s been taken care of. Thank God. Miles outside of Pendelton. See you on Founder’s Day. Good-bye. He hangs up the phone. DEAN ADAMS (cont‘d) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: I was just thinking it might not be a bad idea to add a few extra guards this weekend. In case --

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: In case what?

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: Anything should happen.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: Tell me something? What kind of frightening message do you want to send out to our students, Reese? I think what Pendelton needs right now is a few extra counselors so we can get on the road to healing. Don’t you agree?

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: That story about the massacre. Is there anything to it? He stares at her harshly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DEAN ADAMS
dialogues.text: I think you should re-read your job description and stick to it. And listen to me and listen well...anything happen on campus this weekend, you don’t blink till you contact me first. Understood?

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: (holding back anger) Understood. She turns away and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie walks into the high tech new sports center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's practically deserted. Video monitors hang from the ceiling. A news ANCHORWOMAN is speaking.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORWOMAN
dialogues.text: The storm is expected to bring up to eight inches of rain tonight throughout most of New England. Local authorities are advising residents to avoid venturing out. Natalie walks up to one of the large windows that look do into the pool area and peeks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
