dialogues.text: Brenda is down in the pool, swimming.’ Natalie knocks on window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Brenda as she swims. We see Natalie up above. T knocking is inaudible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie stops and walks over to the door leading to the p It’s locked. She walks back to the glass and looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The locker room door in the pool area opens. A cloud of steam rushes out and a FIGURE in a black parka emerges fr inside. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE'S FACE
dialogues.text: She’s overcome with panic. She starts BANGING on the window.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Brenda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We only hear silence as Brenda finishes her lap. The kill is standing at the edge of the pool, seemingly waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is BANGING as hard as she can. She looks around. one’s in sight.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Help! Someone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda reaches the edge and begins to pull herself out. T killer is reaching for something in his coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie turns to her side and sees a small TABLE. She gra it and SMASHES it against the glass, cracking it slightly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda, wearing a one-piece lycra bathing suit that shows her taut physique, looks up. At the same.time, the FIGURE removes the parka, revealing a female SWIMMER in a bathin suit. NATALIE is frozen, holding onto the table. Bad call. Suddenly, A HAND reaches over and grabs her shoulder. Natalie jumps, startled. She turns to find a WORK-STUDY EMPLOYEE.

dialogues.speaker: WORK-STUDY EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: Um. Problem with the furniture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie and Brenda are walking alone through the quad. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Michelle and her in the car, laughing; the flashing of th passing car; Natalie arguing with Michelle; The car skidd The dead YOUNG MAN. Suddenly, a FIGURE appears behind them. He trails them slowly.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: And you and Michelle never spoke again?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: A little at first. But I couldn’t forgive her for what she did. And I guess I couldn't forgive myself for not doing something more to stop it. Natalie is now in tears. Brenda puts her arm around her. Suddenly... THE FIGURE jumps in front of their face. It’s Parker. He' waving the bloody finger in their faces.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: See, I told you it was a practical joke. Damon left a rubber finger in Hootie’s food bowl.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: What? .

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: You know, so he can chew on. That choking dog legend...

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Never heard of it.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Yeah well, when you get to be my age, you'd have heard them all. That fuck. Something could've happened to Hootie. Natalie looks away. She doesn’t know what to say. PARKER (cont‘d) So you girls coming to the party tonight?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (answering for Natalie) Yes. We’ll be there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Cool. Remember, we're commemorating a massacre so wear all black. Oh, and gory face paint is strongly encouraged. Later. He walks off.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Brenda, I don't know if--

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Natalie, a party is exactly what you need right now. I mean, what are you gonna do, lock yourself in your room in case some imaginary -- Natalie looks at her. BRENDA (cont'd) Okay...a possibly non-existent serial killer tracks you down and kills you like an urban legend...come on, what's he gonna do? Feed you poison pop rocks? Natalie smiles slightly.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Will you promise to stick around me?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Of course. Unless I hook up with Paul. Then you'll have to fend for yourself. But since that's destined not too happen...you're in luck. They both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is cleaning out his desk.

dialogues.speaker: DESK DRAWER
dialogues.text: Paul opens it up with a key and clears away some papers t reveal an old BINDER. It reads “Pendelton Daily News - 1973.” He opens it up. The first newspaper has a huge headline, “Massacre at Stanley Hall.” Paul turns to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Janitor is dumping out the trash. They lock eyes for brief second before the janitor looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dean is approaching his black Lexus, briefcase in han It’s the last car left on the floor. We hear the CHIRP of the car alarm as he shuts it off. He hesitates for a mome before opening the door. He peers through the window into the backseat...just in case. He laughs at himself and sha his head. He sticks the key in the lock, when...

dialogues.speaker: OUCH
dialogues.text: He winces and jumps back. He looks down...there’s blood gushing from his right ankle. He stares down. Is there something under the car? He slowly bends down to look, when... A SWITCHBLADE WIELDING HAND swings out and slices through Dean's left ankle. DEAN ADAMS (cont‘d)

dialogues.speaker: AAAAAHHH
dialogues.text: He falls to the ground. Blood is pouring from the wound. attempts to stand when the blade swings out again, slicin the other ankle. He looks back. The Killer in the black parka is underneath the car. The Dean, his face glazd wit horror, starts crawling away. The killer rolls out from underneath the car and grabs th Dean's leg. The Dean takes his briefcase and swings it at the killer’s head, knocking him down. The Dean hoists himself up but can’t walk. His Achilles tendon is sliced. He tumbles down and drags himself as fa as he can down the decline in the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killer climbs in and sets the car in neutral. He turn the steering wheel and sends the car down the decline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dean is almost to the pedestrian entrance. He‘s out o breath and sweating. He turns around and sees... HIS CAR rolling down in his direction. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THE DEAN crawls faster. He's almost to the barricade separating the entrance from the garage when... THE CAR slams into him, CRUSHING him against the barricad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm is quickly brewing as rain pours heavily and flashes of LIGHTNING light up the sky. Crazed college students are flooding into the house. A blow up CORPSE ha at the entrance. Music BLARES from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is dressed in black. Some of the kids are wearin ghoulish death makeup. Everyone is drinking and having a good time. The song “Rollercoaster of Love” is playing.

dialogues.speaker: HOOTIE
dialogues.text: The tube of a beer funnel is in his mouth. Parker holds h up as he happily laps up the beer.

dialogues.speaker: HOOTIE
dialogues.text: Hootie, unable to drink anymore, pulls away, getting his soaked by the splashing beer.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: That's my boy!

dialogues.speaker: STEREO
dialogues.text: Sasha is standing there with a NERDY GUY. She rolls her e at Parker's antics.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: I swear, my primal urges for dumb lugs with large genitalia are quickly diminishing. The part, of “Rollercoaster of Love” where a girl SCREAMS blasting.

dialogues.speaker: NERDY GUY
dialogues.text: (clears throat; flirtatious) Did you know that this is an actual cry for help by a girl being murdered? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) You're kidding me!

dialogues.speaker: NERDY GUY
dialogues.text: Yup. Lifted right off a 911 tape. That’s why it sounds so real.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: I'll never be able to listen to this in the same way again! She rolls her eyes and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Natalie walks in alone. She looks around and finds Brenda

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Well it seems rather tame. Out of nowhere, a wet Hootie scurries past them, dragging beer funnel with him, teeth clenching onto the hose.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Spoke too soon. I‘m going to the kitchen to get something to drink....want anything?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: A beer.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: You got it. Brenda walks off. Natalie turns around to find an OLD

dialogues.speaker: NEWSPAPER
dialogues.text: directly in front of her face. Paul is holding it.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: It’s not a legend.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Where did you find that?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Someone left it in my desk.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I don‘t know. Maybe that janitor. There was one survivor that night Natalie. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He points to a PICTURE of a young Charles Wexler. The caption reads, “Charles Wexler ~-- sole survivor of his floor.", Natalie and Paul stare at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the 0.S. sound of falling RAIN and THUNDER. We pu down a long, dimly lit hallway where Reese is making her rounds, checking to see that each door is locked. A SMASH heard around the corner. She quickly pulls out her gun and gets up against the wal inching slowly towards the corner -- very “Charlie's Ange Reese jumps, gun drawn, to face the possible foe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An open window is blowing open and shut one of the office doors. Reese laughs to herself. She walks to the window, shuts it. She goes to close the door. The sign on it read “Professor Wexler.” The door doesn’t shut. She looks down and sees the end of a lamp peeking out. Reese is puzzled. She opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's completely dark. :

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: Hello? A flash of lightning reveals that the office has been completely wrecked. Something is not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha is talking loudly to a couple of other GIRLS as Bre fills up a couple of cups with beer from the keg.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: So I heard the biology T.A. was in the emergency room last week.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: The cute one?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Mmm-Hmm. Seems he had a furry friend stuck up his poop shoot. Brenda turns around. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: A gerbil?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: You did not hear it from me.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: I just want all of you to know, my radio show's taken a very strong position against gerbilling. (to Brenda) Did you see Paul?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: He’s here?

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: I just saw him chatting Natalie up.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Thanks for letting me know. Brenda walks away. Sasha turns back to the girls and they continue gossiping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Natalie are sitting alone on the stairs that lea to the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I doubted you.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it. We just gotta get a hold of the cops. .

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Seems Dean Adams already beat us to it. + They thought it was a practical joke.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Paul it almost feels like we’re being set up...like we’re becoming a part of someone else’s elaborate urban legend.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You listen to me...the only legend we'll ever be a part of is our own, very happy one, you understand? They look deep into each other’s eyes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Most urban legends...there’s some sort of ironic twist.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Someone gets what they deserve in some unexpected way. I get it. So maybe, if this is our legend...we’d be getting to that twist right about now. Paul slowly eases his lips unto hers. They kiss passionately. As they make out, we see A SHADOW come over them. Natalie opens her eyes and quickly pulls back. It's Brenda, standing in front of them, holding two beers She’s not happy.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Let him come to me, huh Natalie?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: No Brenda --

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Here. It's a light. She shoves the beer in Natalie’s face, spilling most of i and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Brenda! Shit.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: What was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: She...has a thing for you.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Kinda figured.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I’m going to get her. 100 INT. PROF. WEXLER’S OFFICE - NIGHT. © 100 Reese grabs her flashlight and shines it on the office. S slowly walks around. A disaster. Papers everywhere, a turned over chair. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She walks towards the closet door slowly. She holds her breath and swings it open.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSET
dialogues.text: The ax and the black parka are missing. Reese steps back. She almost slips, dropping her flashlight. She holds hers up against the desk. When she looks down, the flashlight shining in a pool of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker and the other frat guys are drinking shots. Natali approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Have you seen Brenda?

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Running out the front door. Paul walks over to Parker and whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Look Parker, it might be a good idea to end this party a little early.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (whispering) There may be a killer out there. It’s not safe,

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Really? (screaming) EVERYONE! EVERYONE!

dialogues.speaker: LISTEN UP
dialogues.text: The music quiets down. People turn around and face Parker PARKER (cont'd) Paul here thinks I should end the party! BOO'’S from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Come on man.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Now tell everyone why you think they should go home. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Paul looks at Natalie. He’s on the spot.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: There’s a serial killer out there. The room bursts into LAUGHTER. PARKER (cont’‘d) And let me guess...this serial killer is offing people based on urban legends.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: That's right. Again everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: I've got a legend you may or may not have heard of. Mediocre, attention seeking, Woodward and Bernstein wanna-be realizes he's gonna graduate and end up writing gardening tips for Martha Stewart's “Living.” Unless, of course, he finds something to write about that’ll give him lots of attention and a possible job. Aaaah's from the crowd. Natalie stares heavily at Paul. PARKER (cont‘d) There’s not much happening in hicksville so he takes advantage of his homicidal instincts and starts killing people ina trendy, cover of Time, very special edition of Oprah way. Basing them on urban legends. . Paul stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Yeah Parker. Doesn‘t sound like a bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Maybe you're the one that should take off and let everyone else have a good time. Paul nods then looks at’ Natalie. one last time before wa out. INT. PROF. WEXLER‘S OFFICE - NIGHT. 102 Reese is on the phone with the Dean's answering machine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: _ DEAN ADAMS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Please leave a message.

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: Hi, Dean Adams. This is Reese. Are you there? Hello? She slams the phone down. She taps her fingers on her des unsure of what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drunk Parker’s pigging out on leftover pizza and drinki beer. The microwave is on. It sounds like popcorn popping The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: (mouth full) Hello? (no answer) Hello? He slams the phone down and gets back to the pizza when t phone rings again. 7 PARKER (cont'd) What!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUISED VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Oh really? He walks over with the cordless to the Caller ID. It read “Damon Brooks: 618-563-0562.” PARKER (cont'd) The call’s coming from inside the house. This is very familiar. Could it be? An urban legend. Am I right? Hello? Don’t get shy on me all of a sudden, fuckface. Parker starts heading out of the kitchen. PARKER (cont’d) This is the one about the baby-sitter. She's getting the scary, harassing phone calls. And when she traces them... they’re coming from inside the house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oe 104 INT. FOYER - NIGHT. 104 Parker is standing at the edge of the stairs. He starts walking up. PARKER (cont'd) But...ass wipe...aren‘’t you forgetting something? I’m not baby-sitting any kids!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUISED VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wrong legend. This is the one about the old lady who dries her wet dog in the microwave. A loud series of BEEPS coming from the kitchen. Parker sp around and runs back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The microwave has just stopped. He walks slowly towards i Stares at it. Pops it open.

dialogues.speaker: HIS FACE
dialogues.text: A look of horror. He looks away in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: (breaking up) Hootie! (into phone) You sick motherfucker! He turns and runs out. 106 INT. DAMON’S ROOM - NIGHT. . 106 Parker bursts in, still clutching onto his beer. The phon is off the receiver. He tears the room apart.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: (hysterical) Damon I’m gonna furnish you with a new ASSHOLE! You hear me?!? He walks towards the closed closet door. Swings it open. BOOM! A basketball bounces off his head. He heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker staggers down the hallway, cup of beer still in hi hand. There’s a closed door. He swings it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A JOCK BROTHER and a TRASHY GIRL are having sex.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Sorry man, it’s just --

dialogues.speaker: JOCK BROTHER
dialogues.text: Get the hell out of here!

dialogues.speaker: TRASHY GIRL
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: PARKER
dialogues.text: Sorry. Parker shuts the door. He takes another swig of the beer. He holds his stomach. He looks like he’s going to be sick He goes inside the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker sets the beer down and lifts up the toilet seat. H kneels, about to throw up, when...

dialogues.speaker: A GLOVED HAND
dialogues.text: grabs the toilet seat and SLAMS it on his head, knocking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie looks up at the ceiling. She heard something. She looks around nervously. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker comes to. He’s bound and gagged. The beer funnel tube stuck in his mouth. The Killer hovers over him. He grabs a packet of Pop Rocks from his pocket ahd pours it the funnel. Parker’s muffled SCREAMS are quickly eclipsed the sound of SNAPPING AND POPPING. The killer then grabs bottle of Drano and pours it completely down the funnel. Parker starts spasming wildly. Finally he stops. Dead. Th killer removes the tube and tape from his mouth. Blue liq and pop rocks drool down the sides of Parker’s mouth, the only sound the CRACKLING of the candy. He exits the room.  76.
od 111 INT. LIVING ROOM - NIGHT. 111 Sasha walks out of the kitchen and towards Natalie. She looks impatient.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Where the hell is he? He knows I have to be at work in fifteen minutes and I am not walking in this rain.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Look for the dog. You know wherever Hootie is, so is Parker.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Can't find the mutt either. She looks to a wooden keyholder hanging on the wall. She grabs one of the keys. SASHA (cont'd) I’m taking his car. You need a ride back to your dorm? rm Natalie thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reese picks up the phone and dials "911." She gets a recording.

dialogues.speaker: RECORDED MESSAGE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: All circuits are busy. Please try your call again later. Lightning FLASHES and thunder RUMBLES outside. Reese shak her head incredulously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha pulls up alongside Natalie’s dorm. It’s barely visi through -che pouring rain.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: ...SO you two wanna get jiggy with each other, but Brenda’s into him too. Do you know how many calls I’ve gotten about ~ similar situations? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know what to do. I don’t want to hurt her.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Well, what’s more important to you? The best advice I can give you is to be honest...otherwise it could turn into a bad Jerry Springer scenario. Gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Thanks Sasha.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Anytime. Call me at the station later if you're bored. Come up with some scandalous questions.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Will do. Natalie gets out of the car and runs to the front door of dorm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie walks towards her room. It’s the first time she’s been there since Tosh’s death. She puts the key in the lo holds her breath and opens the door. INT. NATALIE‘S DORM - NIGHT. 115 Still standing in the hallway, Natalie reaches in and tur on the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room looks the same. She shuts the door behind her an double locks. She looks at the wall where the message was scrawled. There’s a fresh coat of white paint, but underneath it we can still make out a faint shade of red. Natalie looks away. She grabs her walkman. There’s a FLAS of lightning and Natalie jumps into bed, covering herself with the blanket. She turns on the radio and tunes to Sas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha is talking into her wireless mike. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CALLER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It just feels soooo awkward for me to go get birth control pills. So Sasha, I did something really bad.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CALLER
dialogues.text: Well my roommate has birth control pills.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: So you borrowed some.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CALLER
dialogues.text: Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: She doesn’t know?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CALLER
dialogues.text: I’ve been replacing them.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: What have you been replacing them with?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CALLER
dialogues.text: (losing it) Baby aspirin...Now she’s pregnant and I don't know what to do! Suddenly the line goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Hello? INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - NIGHT. 117 Natalie is listening.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Can anyone out there hear me? She sits up in bed. Something’s not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha starts hitting every button on the switchboard. Nothing. SASHA (cont'd) ; (into mike) WVOP, Voice of Pendelton. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pan down to the window looking into the engineering room. It’s dark inside. Her reflection is clearly visible on th glass. Sasha slowly walks towards it. She’s in front of h reflection. She presses her face against the glass, tryin to peer inside. Suddenly, the lights in the engineering r glow brightly revealing...

dialogues.speaker: THE KILLER
dialogues.text: directly in front of her face. Sasha SCREAMS. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - NIGHT. 119 The SCREAM jolts Natalie out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killer SMASHES through the glass with the ax. Sasha moves away before the blade slashes her. She runs to the door, tries opening it...locked. .

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE DOOR
dialogues.text: It's been blocked with some office furniture.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BOOTH
dialogues.text: With each swing of the ax, glass flies across the room. T opening in the glass is getting larger. Sasha is BANGING the door, looking back in terror. INT. NATALIE’S ROOM - NIGHT. 121 Natalie tries calling Sasha. She gets a busy signal and hangs up. She looks worried. :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nerdy guy we'd met earlier Shh's everyone up and turn the volume on the radio. People are suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: NERDY GUY
dialogues.text: Listen! She’s doing a radio play to commemorate the massacre. AAAHH’S from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killer’s almost broken through the glass. Sasha manag to open the door enough to climb through.  124 125 126 127 128 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha squeezes through the opening, over the furniture.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND HER
dialogues.text: The killer’s almost to her. Sasha pushes back the furnitu to keep him in. He starts banging on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha runs down the steps and goes to open the front door It’s locked up. She starts banging on it.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Please! If anyone can hear me! There's someone trying to kill me. It’s glass so she can see out. The jogger we'd seen earli is running past the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jogger runs on,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone listens intently.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Please...I don’t wanna die.

dialogues.speaker: NERDY GUY
dialogues.text: She's a pro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha turns around.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: The killer is now at the top of the stairs. SASHA (cont-d)

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: She looks around --- the elevator.  —_ 129 130 131 132 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs in and presses 3, the last floor, then pounds on “Door Close.” As the doors shut, the Killer tries to stic his arm in, but it’s too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is walking swiftly in the rain, holding an umbrel She’s heading for the station. She’s listening to Sasha CRYING on her walkman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator slowly goes up to the third floor. The doors open onto a shelf-lined room filled with old records. She steps out cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trembling, she walks slowly through the room. She spots a window and runs to it. She opens it up. Climbs halfway ou

dialogues.speaker: GROUND
dialogues.text: It looks like quite a drop.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: One...Two... Just as she jumps, the killer plunges his knife into her hand.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUISED VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Three. Sasha is left dangling off the side of the building as th knife holds her hand to the sill. She SCREAMS in pain as killer pulls her up and throws her against one of the rec shelves, toppling one over. He walks over to her, holding up his knife. He goes to plunge it into her chest. She rolls over and the knife go straight through a Celine Dion album. Sasha pushes one of the shelves on top of him, knocking h down. She hobbles towards the stairs. As she makes her wa down... THE KILLER appears behind her and shoves her down the sta She crawls into the radio booth.  133 134 135 136 137 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is BANGING on the front door. Locked. Suddenly, music PLAYS on her walkman. “Rollercoaster of Love.” She backs away and looks up at the window looking into Sasha’ booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha backs into a corner.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Please, anyone listening -- The killer bursts into the room. SASHA (cont'd) He's going to...AAAAAHHHH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the GIRL’S SCREAM in “Rollercoaster of Love.” we hea Sasha's SCREAM. The remaining party guests listen in. The start laughing.

dialogues.speaker: NERDY GUY
dialogues.text: She remembered the story I told her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reese is driving through campus scanning through the radi stations. It stops on WVOP and the horrific SCREAM. She can’t understand what is going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is listening on in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window, we see Sasha jumps up. Her last gasp. She presses her hands against the glass. As she falls slowly, the blood smears. Behind her we now see THE KILLE The song abruptly stops. Another one starts playing....Blondie. “One way, or another, I’m gonna find ya...I‘m gonna getcha, I’m gonna getcha getcha getcha --” The killer is looking down on Natalie. Horrified, she run away.  138 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is banging on his door. No answer. Someone slowly walks up to her from behind. Paul.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Hey. Natalie hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Paul... He's completely soaked. She lets go and eyes him suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I just moved my car into the garage. The lot out back was flooding. What's wrong? Natalie breaks down.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Sasha’s dead! I saw her Paul. I know he’s coming after us. We have to get help. Paul is shocked. He runs into his room picks up the phone PAUL (cont‘d) It's dead. God damn storm. Natalie, let's just get out of here. . He gets up and heads for the door. Natalie stares at him then picks up the phone. He looks back at her.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I was just making sure --

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I told you the phones were dead. You . didn’t believe me. Tell me, if I were the killer, don’t you think I would've killed you by now?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: I don't know, it‘’d probably be smarter to wait till we were out of your room. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Better legend possibilities, right? She stays quiet. PAUL (cont'd) Come on, let’s go. She hesitates before heading out with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie and Paul step out of his dorm. They’re huddled closely under an umbrella.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Where are you parked?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Over there -- As he points, there’s a sudden FLASH of lightning revealing... BRENDA standing in front of them. They jump, startled. She's soaked.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (worried) I heard Sasha on the radio. What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Brenda, It’s no joke. There’s a killer on campus. Sasha's dead. :

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Come on, we're leaving. Brenda looks at them both. Natalie grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Brenda, I’m sorry. But you’re my best friend and I’m not leaving you here. Brenda nods and follows them.  140 141 142 143 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reese runs out of her car in the rain. She takes out a la keyring and opens the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks to the elevator and presses the call button. Lo around. Just as the elevator door opens, there’s a BLAST thunder. Reese jumps and looks out the window, unaware of INT. ELEVATOR - NIGHT. Sasha's dead body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the door begins to close, Reese turns and comes face t face with the horrible sight. The door slams shut.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. PAUL’S CAR - NIGHT. 143 The group is driving down the dark road out of campus. They're all silent. The only sound, the SQUEAKING of the windshield wipers. Natalie grimaces in disgust. Brenda is breathing through her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: What is that smell?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Dirty laundry. Sorry. Outside, there’s a brightly lit Shell station in the distance. The same one Michelle drove past.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Why don’t we stop there and see if the phones work?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I just wanna drive straight into. town.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Paul, Brenda's right.. The roads are a mess. You shouldn't be driving. He looks at them. :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie and Brenda stand outside. The overhead carport ke them dry. Natalie is leaning against the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is inside, talking to the clerk.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: I‘m fine with you two together, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Brenda, I fucked up. I shouldn’t have done what I did.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: No. Look, I thought about it. And I'm not going to be one of those selfish, just-because-I-don’ t-have-a-boyfriend- doesn‘ t-mean-you-can’‘t-have-one-either type of friends. You two like each other. You should be together. Natalie smiles at her. She goes to give her a hug, steppi away from the trunk. BRENDA (cont’d) Natalie. She points at the trunk. It’s unlocked and there's a piec of cloth sticking out of it. Brenda walks over and starts open it. They both make a face as they catch a strong whi of whatever's stinking.up the car.

dialogues.speaker: TOGETHER
dialogues.text: Ugggh. Brenda opens the trunk all the way. Their eyes widen. Lyi inside is Professor Wexler’s body, his toupee stuffed in mouth. She lets go of the top.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: He's still talking to the clerk.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Like I said...you could keep him.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: We have to get out of here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PAUL is heading out.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: We're in the middle of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Yeah and you think he’s planning to drive us into town? PAUL steps out of the store. Natalie and Brenda smile, wa then run the hell out.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Hey! What the hell! NATALIE AND BRENDA run into the woods, back towards campu PAUL starts chasing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATALIE AND BRENDA smash through a thicket of branches, trying to keep from slipping in the rain.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: (crying) Natalie where are we going?!?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (breathless) Back to campus.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: WHAT ARE YOU DOING
dialogues.text: The girls pick up their pace. Brenda’s lagging behind Natalie. Natalie stops to catch her breath. She looks bac Brenda’s gone. NATALIE (cont’d) Brenda? She’s all alone. She scans the area. Out of nowhere... A DEER jumps over a fallen tree, startling her. Natalie laughs, relieved. Then a loud,. ghastly SCREAM echoes thr the woods. It’s Brenda. ‘ NATALIE (cont‘d) Brenda! Natalie hears FOOTSTEPS approaching. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Natalie? Natalie starts running frantically. She slips and falls down, then quickly gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie runs into the road, crying. She’s caught in the headlights of an incoming car. The car comes to a screech halt. It’s the Janitor. He steps out.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Help me!

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: He's after me! Please, people are dying!

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: Get in the car. I'll drive us out of here. Natalie nods and climbs in. INT. JANITOR’S CAR - NIGHT. 147 They're heading out of campus. Natalie is holding herself trembling.

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: Oh my, this is horrible. He notices her shivering. JANITOR (cont‘d) I’ve got a coat in the backseat. Put it on. Natalie turns around. In the backseat is a BLACK PARKA. S turns around slowly. Stares at him. JANITOR (cont'd) It ain’t gonna bite ya. Put it on.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: No that’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: The car spéeds past an intersection. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NATALIE (cont‘d) You missed the turn.

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: I know a shortcut. The janitor stares straight ahead, his face blank. Natali nervous now.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Look, why don’t you drop me off here.

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: What? She goes to open the door. He locks it. JANITOR (cont’d) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: . NATALIE
dialogues.text: Please, just let me out.

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna do that. Natalie furiously starts banging on the door, trying to o it. JANITOR (cont'd) Stop that! What’s wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: A car is driving in their direction. Its headlights are turned off.

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: Idiot kids. They've almost passed the car. Natalie looks up and reali what’s happening.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH BEAM SWITCH
dialogues.text: The janitor is about to pull on it to signal them.

dialogues.speaker: NOOOO
dialogues.text: Too late. The high beam’s flashed. The car speeds past them. It’s Paul’s car. It makes a sharp u-turn and starts chasing them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NATALIE (cont‘d) It’s him.

dialogues.speaker: SIDE MIRROR
dialogues.text: The hooded figure is driving the car. THE JANITOR tries flooring the accelerator but the car be to lose control in the rain. He slows down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul’s car starts slamming into the back of the janitor’s INT. JANITOR’S CAR - NIGHT. 149 The janitor is trying to keep the car from skidding out o the road.

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: What is he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM. Paul’s car hits the janitor’s. INT. JANITOR’S CAR - NIGHT. . 151 The janitor is trying to keép control of the car.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Come on... Paul’s car pulls up alongside the janitor’s. The killer i staring straight at her. He SMASHES into-the side of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The janitor’s car flies head first into a ditch. INT. JANITOR‘S CAR - NIGHT. 153 It’s quiet. The only sound, the rain RAGING outside. The janitor is unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey! The killer appears at the driver's side window. He's hold a knife. Natalie SCREAMS. He opens the door. She tries opening her door. It’s blocked. She rolls down the window The killer’climbs in. He swings his knife but misses. Wit (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: one swift movement, Natalie KICKS him. He drops his knife She climbs out the window just as he’s grabbing for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She’s running as fast as she can when she looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul’s car is gone and so is the killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reese bursts through the door. The intensity we saw in he eyes when we first met her is back. She looks over to the “Foxy Brown” poster and locks eyes with Pam Grier. NOTE: Funky, early 70's blaxploitation music scores the rest of scene. Reese opens up a drawer with a key and takes out a wooden box. Inside lies a huge, silver Colt .45 with a mother-of pearl handle. She loads the cartridge and CLANKS it shut. With one quick motion, she bends her knees, holds the gun straight out and points it to her reflection in the mirro Reese is one Bad Mama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is running through the wet, desolate campus. She stops at an emergency phone, picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello? It‘s dead. We hear a faint 0.S. SCREAM. .Natalie turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley Hall brightly lit in a FLASH of lightning. Natali drops the phone and walks towards the dorm. Again, a SCRE This time, the voice is distinct.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Someone! Help! NATALIE (cont'd) Brenda? Natalie looks from side to side, there’s no one around. S holds her breath and runs towards the entrance.  157 158 159 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie climbs through the broken wood that boards up one the windows and falls into the dorm. Inside it’s dusty an bare. A FLASH of lightning reveals some rats scuttling through the room.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Help me! Natalie looks up. Brenda’s upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie cautiously walks up the stairs. Again she hears t SCREAM. It sounds like it’s coming from behind the closed door up ahead. She opens it up. It’s one of the old dorm rooms. She heads in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of twin-sized beds fill up most of the room. There’s a broken down desk to the side. Natalie doesn’t s

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR BEHIND HER SHUT
dialogues.text: She spins around. Tries to open it. Someone’s locked her in. She panics. There’s a couple of other doors in the room. She rushes to one, opens it. Suddenly, a beer keg propped against the door falls down. Some beer pours out. It becomes more and more reddish and then PARKER'S HEAD spills out. Natalie SCREAMS. She turns to run and slips in the beer.. She crawls away. She's up against the bed. Another FLASH lightning reveals AN ARM sticking out from underneath the Mattress. Natalie jumps. Stands up. She stares at the arm Slowly lifts up the mattress... ‘ THE DEAN is inside the box spring. Natalie is in tears. She runs to the other door. When she opens it, DAMON’S BODY swings out. He’s still hung.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Noooo! There's another room beyond Damon. It’s lit. ‘She has no choice and must walk through the doorway, right up agains him. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie looks in. It’s lit by dozens of candles. She sees Brenda lying on the bed. She walks to her. She’s dead. Natalie starts crying. She sinks down to the floor. A SHADOW rises over her. She turns around and... A FIST slams into her face, knocking her out. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie regains consciousness. She’s tied up and gagged i bed. She struggles but it’s pointless. To her side is a hospital operating room tray with medical equipment, including a large SCALPEL. The Killer in the parka appear Takes off the hood. It’s Brenda. She smiles at Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Gotcha! Natalie looks at her in disbelief. BRENDA (cont’d) I must say, you've proved your friendship to me Natalie. Coming to my rescue without even a little pepper spray to defend yourself. Very endearing. Natalie tries to talk through the gag. BRENDA (cont'd) Excuse me? I’m sorry, I can’t understand a thing you're saying doll. Now if I remove the gag, you gotta promise me you won’t scream or it goes back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reese is driving through campus, big gun sitting in the passenger seat. In the distance is Stanley Hall. Somethin catches her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's light flickering in one of the second floor windo She hits the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda removes the gag from Natalie’s mouth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: a NATALIE You're fucking crazy.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: I prefer the term “eccentric.” But yeah, I guess you can say I’ma little nutty.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Why? Why? You still haven’t figured it out. Well, lucky for you Miss Thing, I've got a visual aid. She takes out a slide machine, the same one from Wexler’s class, and turns it on. The image reflects off the wall opposite Natalie. She CLICKS. A picture of a younger, happier Brenda appears. She’s holding hands with a YOUNG MAN. . BRENDA (cont'd) There I am with my boyfriend. The love of my life, Natalie. Have you met the love of your life yet? Of course not, oo you’re too self-involved to bother.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Something in the picture is familiar. BRENDA (cont‘d) Pic ringing any bells Nat?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Ding ding ding. Brenda CLICKS the slide machine. A picture of a newspaper clipping appears. The headline, “Teenager Killed in Appar Gang Initiation.”

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: . Marty Stuart was his name. The one you and your friend decided to have a little fun with, that one night.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Brenda, I wasn’t -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: You weren't driving. But it was your car Natalie. And you were there. Didn’t you tell me something about not being able to forgive yourself? Well, I thought, as a friend, I could help you out in that area. Brenda stares at the picture. There’s a trace of sadness her eyes. But just. for a second. She turns back to Natalie. BRENDA (cont’d) The reporters immediately jumped on the gang story because it was so much more interesting than a couple of ditzy cheerleaders playing a practical joke.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: They made the correction the next day.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Too late. The urban legend had already spread. You two never even spent a night in jail for what you did. Payback’s a bitch, isn’t it, Natalie?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Please Brenda, you need to get help.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: I told you I already tried therapy. Obviously did me no good. I must say, I kinda enjoyed all of this. Playing with your head. You used an urban legend to kill my boyfriend and now. Brenda laughs. She walks to the tray and grabs the scalpe

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Just my fave U.L. The kidney heist. You know this one don’t you? Guy gets picked up by a woman at a bar. They go back to her hotel room. She gives him a drink. It's drugged. He’s knocked out. When he wakes up...one of his kidney’s been removed. Supposedly they’re sold on the black market to wealthy foreigners in need of organ transplants. Don’t think it’s ever really happened...till tonight. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She walks She goes. t 96.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: You won't get away with this.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Of course I will. I‘ve got the perfect murderer in the trunk of Paul’s car...Wexler.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: You're sick.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: This was his room you know. He probably slept in that same bed when that crazy professor came and tried to kill him. Twenty-five years ago this weekend. It’s a pattern. Tonight he does away with students and kills himself...in the same manner as the course he teaches! It‘s so clean isn’t it? The symmetry of it all. Well, enough chat! to Natalie’s side. BRENDA (cont'd) Unfortunately, I have no anesthesia. Sorry. You'll just have to bite real hard on the gag and hopefully go into shock soon enough.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Please don’t do this...

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Don’t you want to become an urban legend Natalie? All your friends are now. Brenda lifts up Natalie’s shirt. BRENDA (cont‘d) Now let me see...is the kidney here or is that the liver? I was always such a dope at anatomy. Who cares, right? First organ I see...I’m grabbin’ it! o stuff the gag in Natalie’s mouth. Natalie bites her hand hard. BRENDA (cont‘d) Ouch! You stupid bitch! She slaps Natalie. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BRENDA (cont’d) I’m really gonna enjoy watching you bleed to death. Brenda stuffs the gag into her mouth. she takes the scalp and traces over Natalie’s skin. Blood is coming out of th cut. Through the gag Natalie is SCREAMING in terror. BRENDA (cont‘d) Paul's going to have his story after all. And I'm going to have him. What did you think? I was going let you take two guys out of my life?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sorry Brenda. You're not my type. They turn to look. Paul is standing at the door. PAUL (cont'd) Saw my car next door. You’re not as clever as you think.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Oh great. I’m running out of legends here Paul. What am I gonna have to do with you?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Drop it. BRENDA (cont'd) From the looks of it, I’m the one with the weapon here so...make me. Reese steps into the doorway next to Paul, Colt .45 drawn

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: With pleasure. Brenda looks on, unbelievingly. She drops the.scalpel.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Well, well, if it isn’t wanna-be cop.

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: Get your hands up and stand against the wall, you loonie-psycho bitch. Brenda grudgingly follows orders. Reese walks over to her Paul runs to Natalie and removes her gag. They hug passionately. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Neither am I. He starts untying her.

dialogues.speaker: REESE AND BRENDA
dialogues.text: Reese is patting Brenda down. Brenda looks down at her co pocket. Just as Reese is about to touch it, Brenda draws knife out of the pocket and slashes her. Reese drops her gun. Brenda grabs it. Just as Reese lunges for her, she shoots her.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: He’s running towards her. She points the gun at him.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Don’t move! Oh Pauly, you sure you don’t want to reconsider? We could be so...cute together.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Sure I’1ll reconsider. He walks towards her.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (sweetly) Yeah. Just give me the gun. Brenda's taken by him. She starts to lower the gun. They exchange smiles. Suddenly, he lunges at her. knocking her down. A SHOT escapes, puncturing the ceiling. Brenda drop the gun. The two of them struggle on the floor. She’s reaching for it, when... A HAND GRABS THE GUN. Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Get off of him. Brenda stands against the boarded up window. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: You're gonna shoot me Natalie? Huh? What kind of friend are you. She goes for Natalie when a loud BANG stops her cold. Another BANG and Brenda flies back, CRASHING through the rotted wood boarding up the window. She lands with a THUD outside, REESE, is holding onto the standard issue security gun sh usually carried. Her pant leg is raised and we see the hidden holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda lies on the wet asphalt, motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie looks down.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey...Can you give me a hand here? Natalie turns around. She casually sticks the gun in her coat pocket. Paul is on the floor, obviously in pain. She gives him a hand. Reese is breathing heavily, lying down.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Reese...

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: (weakly; bittersweet) Got me in the abdomen...thought I’d have to wait to be a cop before that ever happened.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Can you get up?

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: Hell no. Go and get help...quick. Paul and Natalie turn to leave. REESE (cont'd) And Natalie...good work there.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Thanks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Reese winks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Natalie are climbing into his car.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Wait Paul. We should make sure she’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: We don’t have time Natalie! He's right...maybe. She gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: : They're heading out of campus. Paul’s driving.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Me, a serial killer. Good one.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I tell ya, when I write the story, there won't be anything left to sensationalize. BEHIND THEM we see something moving. Brenda.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: This‘1l become a legend too you know.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: No doubt. It‘ll change from person to person though. Brenda will become a guy, You’ll become a criminology student, not a journalist and I'll end up in some insane asylum. Brenda raises an ax. PAUL (cont'd) So...if this is a legend...at what point do we get to the ironic twist?. IN THE BACKSEAT, Brenda is getting ready to swing... CLOSE ON REARVIEW MIRROR. Paul sees her reflection. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PAUL (cont‘d)

dialogues.speaker: DUCK
dialogues.text: Natalie and Paul duck, just as Brenda swings her ax. She narrowly misses their heads. She swings again, misses. It gets stuck on the side of the door. Brenda is going to grab it. Natalie lets her seat go all way back and PUNCHES Brenda in the stomach. Brenda and Natalie are fighting in the backseat. Brenda swings open the back door. She grabs Natalie by the neck pushes her head outside. A tree stump is just a few yards away.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Paul! He swerves the car, knocking Brenda back. Natalie jumps, the tree SLAMS into the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul’s car swerves into another road, heading into the wo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie grabs Reese’s gun. She aims at Brenda and shoots just as the car goes over a bump. The shot SHATTERS the s window.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Watch it! Brenda kicks the gun out of Natalie’s hands. She’s trying pry the ax out. As she does this, Natalie leans up and fastens Paul’s seat belt. They look at each other. He starts speeding up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the lake up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie fastens her seat belt just as Brenda pries the ax loose. She's standing above Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: So did you hear the legend about the girl who didn’t wear her seatbelt? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Neither did I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tree is approaching. INT. PAUL’S CAR - NIGHT. 173 Paul shuts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDA
dialogues.text: She‘s about to swing, when BOOM! Paul SLAMS into the tree Brenda CRASHES through the front windshield, flying out o the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Natalie slowly step outside. It seems calm when suddenly, Brenda jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: AAAAHHH
dialogues.text: Natalie grabs the gun and SHOOTS out every last bullet. Brenda falls into the lake and slowly starts to sink in t rain. Paul and Natalie embrace. They’re completely soaked.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Is this it?

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: For us. But legends never go away. They just change. : They look towards the lake and see Brenda finally sink completely. GUY’S VOICE (0.S.) The lake was so cold, they had to wait a couple of days to get the body. When some special, extreme weather Navy SEAL type guys could get over here and get it out. the thing of it is...they never found a body.  175 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six college kids, guys and girls, are gathered around BLA a young Parkerish frat guy who's finishing telling the st They're sitting in one of the old rooms. It’s lit by candles.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: It wasn't there. Everyone stares at him, wide-eyed. Then, at once, they al begin laughing.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: It’s true guys! Happened right here at Pendelton. I swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: HIPPIE GUY
dialogues.text: So why haven't I heard it before.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: Duh...have you listened? It all keeps getting covered up.

dialogues.speaker: DORKY GUY
dialogues.text: I’ve heard it. Matter of fact, Natalie's my old roommate's cousin.

dialogues.speaker: TRENDY GIRL
dialogues.text: No, Natalie’s my brother's ex- girlfriend’s sister.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: Oh, you see? This is how totally real stories become unbelievable. Everyone has to add a little something to it. Suddenly, Reese appears at the door. They’re startled.

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: As you all probably know, this building . is off limits. So get your asses up and out of here...NOW.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: Hey Reese?

dialogues.speaker: REESE
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He looks around. Everyone’s waiting for him to ask.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: Nothing. They stream past her. She suddenly grabs her stomach. A pain of some sort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group is outside.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Good-bye guys. Thanks for another brain cell deadening session.

dialogues.speaker: HIPPIE GUY
dialogues.text: Hey...be careful out there.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I’m shaking in my Hush Puppies. She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny is on a darkened walkway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lake is in the distance. There’s some fear in her eye She looks away quickly. Leaves RUSTLE behind her. She stops and turns.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Hello? Is there someone there? She rolls her eyes and laughs to herself. JENNY (cont ’d) Paranoid. She turns around. BEHIND HER, a gloved hand reach out and covers her mouth. Her SCREAM is muffled. We see an ax swing up and glisten the moonlight and hear a loud THUMP as we... FADE TO BLACK.
